benchmark_details.name: MathWriting: A Dataset For Handwritten Mathematical Expression Recognition
benchmark_details.overview: MathWriting is the largest dataset of online handwritten mathematical expressions to date, consisting of 230k human-written samples and an additional 400k synthetic ones, aimed at improving the recognition of handwritten mathematical expressions.
benchmark_details.data_type: ink samples with corresponding LaTeX expressions

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark dataset for researching and developing algorithms for the recognition of handwritten mathematical expressions.

data.source: Human contributions through an Android app and synthetic data based on LaTeX expressions from Wikipedia.

methodology.calculation: CER is calculated where a 'character' is defined as a LaTeX token.
methodology.interpretation: Lower CER indicates better recognition accuracy.
methodology.baseline_results: CTC Transformer achieved 5.49 CER on test split.
methodology.validation: Models were evaluated using distinct validation and test splits.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants agreed to standard Google terms of use and privacy policy.
